Uses of Class
org.gearvrf.GVRTexture

  • Packages that use GVRTexture 
    Package Description
    org.gearvrf
    You need to understand key points of this package to create a GVRF application.
    org.gearvrf.asynchronous
    Implementation of asynch resource loading.

    • Uses of GVRTexture in org.gearvrf

      Subclasses of GVRTexture in org.gearvrf 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  GVRBitmapTexture
      Bitmap-based texture.
      class  GVRCubemapTexture
      Cube map texture.
      class  GVRExternalTexture
      Wrapper for a GL_TEXTURE_EXTERNAL_OES texture.
      class  GVRFloatTexture
      A specialized texture, for doing computation on the GPU.
      class  GVRRenderTexture
      Frame Buffer object.

      Methods in org.gearvrf that return types with arguments of type GVRTexture 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRTexture> GVRContext.loadFutureCubemapTexture(GVRAndroidResource resource)
      Simple, high-level method to load a cube map texture asynchronously, for use with GVRShaders.setMainTexture(Future) and GVRShaders.setTexture(String, Future).
      java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRTexture> GVRContext.loadFutureTexture(GVRAndroidResource resource)
      Simple, high-level method to load a texture asynchronously, for use with GVRShaders.setMainTexture(Future) and GVRShaders.setTexture(String, Future).
      java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRTexture> GVRContext.loadFutureTexture(GVRAndroidResource resource, int priority)
      Simple, high-level method to load a texture asynchronously, for use with GVRShaders.setMainTexture(Future) and GVRShaders.setTexture(String, Future).
      java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRTexture> GVRContext.loadFutureTexture(GVRAndroidResource resource, int priority, int quality)
      Simple, high-level method to load a texture asynchronously, for use with GVRShaders.setMainTexture(Future) and GVRShaders.setTexture(String, Future).

      Constructors in org.gearvrf with parameters of type GVRTexture 
      Constructor and Description
      GVRSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext, float width, float height, GVRTexture texture)
      Constructs a 2D, rectangular scene object that uses the standard 'unlit shader' to display a texture.
      GVRSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext, float width, float height, GVRTexture texture, GVRMaterialShaderId shaderId)
      Create a standard, rectangular texture object, using a non-default shader to apply complex visual affects.
      GVRSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext, GVRMesh mesh, GVRTexture texture)
      Constructs a scene object with an arbitrarily complex geometry that uses the standard 'unlit shader' to display a texture.
      GVRSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext, GVRMesh mesh, GVRTexture texture, GVRMaterialShaderId shaderId)
      The base texture constructor: Constructs a scene object with an arbitrarily complex geometry that uses a specific shader to display a texture.
      Constructor parameters in org.gearvrf with type arguments of type GVRTexture 
      Constructor and Description
      GVRSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext, java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRMesh> futureMesh, java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRTexture> futureTexture)
      Very high-level constructor that asynchronously loads the mesh and texture.
